content: This topic was moved to #new members > Why does my lean4 code get an error by Patrick Massot.

namespace NumberTheory

variable (k : â„•) (hk : 1 â‰¤ k)

def aâ‚€ : â„• := a âŸ¨0, hk0âŸ©

example (i : Fin k) : â„• := a i Â -- aáµ¢

def b_i (i : Fin k) : â„• := b i

theorem id_eq_b_i : id (b_i k b i) = b_i k b i := rfl

variable (h_coprime : âˆ€ (i : Fin k), Nat.gcd (a i) (b i) = 1)

def indices (k : â„•) : Finset (Fin k) := Finset.univ

def b_values : Finset â„• := Finset.image b (indices k)

def m (k : â„•) (b : Fin k â†’ â„•) : â„• := fold Nat.lcm 1 b (indices k)
--lemma izj (i : Fink) : i âˆˆ indices k := by
--exact Finset.mem_univ i

lemma mem_indices (i : Fin k) : i âˆˆ indices k := by

Â exact Finset.mem_univ i

lemma b_dvd_m (i : Fin k) : (b_i k b i) âˆ£ m k b := by

Â  unfold m

Â  have mem_b : b iâˆˆ b_values k b := by

Â  Â  unfold b_values

Â  Â  unfold indices

Â  Â  rw [Finset.mem_image]

Â  Â  use i

Â  Â  constructor

Â  Â  . exact Finset.mem_univ i

Â  Â  . rfl

Â  unfold b_i

Â  #check (b_i Â k b i )

Â  have id_eq : id (b_i k b i) = b_i k b i := by

Â  Â  rfl

Â  exact Finset.dvd_lcm Â (s := b_values k b) (f := id) (b := b_i k b i) mem_b

end NumberTheory  ```

type mismatch
dvd_lcm mem_b
has type
id (b_i k b i) âˆ£ (b_values k b).lcm id : Prop
but is expected to have type
b i âˆ£ Finset.fold Nat.lcm 1 b (indices k) : Prop
are the right hand sides the same?
